title: Double Vertical Bar

nouns: A special key on computer keyboards

A key or combination of keys used to tell a computer to halt, or break out of, whatever it is doing. On IBM PCs and compatibles under DOS, pressing the Pause/ Break or Scroll Lock/Break key while holding down the Ctrl key issues the break command (as does Ctrl-C). On Macintosh computers, the key combination that sends a break code is Command-period.
The Break key is a key on a computer keyboard.
A key on a keyboard that temporarily stops the operation of a program or a command. The Pause key is used, for example, to halt scrolling so that a multi-screen listing or document can be read.

description: A pause icon, displayed as two vertical bars.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the pause button emoji is a meticulously crafted icon featuring two vertical, parallel bars rendered in a crisp, solid black with subtle 3D depth. The smooth, rounded corners and precise spacing exemplify Apple's commitment to clean, intuitive design. This emoji, consistently sharp and clear on all Apple devices, is universally understood to signify stopping, holding, or temporarily interrupting an action, such as pausing music or video playback.
